hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Hello everyone! I know that you may be dealing with some feelings of stress or anxiety, please know we are here even if we are not at school. The counselors have created a google form for you, and if you need us, please fill it out. We will get back to you as soon as we can. We are also going to add some websites to this page that may answer some questions you have!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: We are going to post a weekly activity to try with your families every week, this one is called "The Worry Jar."

div.p: Jenny Nugent- Elementary School Counselor- nugentj@nixonsmiley.net
Erica Jones- High School Counselor- jonese@nixonsmiley.net
Maggie Gaytan- All Level Student Service Coordinator- gaytanm@nixonsmiley.net
Moises Para- Middle School Community in Schools- parram@nixonsmiley.net
Jordan Parra- Elementary Community in Schools- parraj@nixonsmiley.net

span.span: ​COVID-19 was discovered in December 2019 and has now spread throughout the world. While there is currently no vaccine to prevent COVID-19, here are a few things you can do to keep your family healthy.
Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a virus (more specifically, a coronavirus) identified as the cause of an outbreak of respiratory illness first detected in Wuhan, China.
HealthyChildren.org - De la American Academy of Pediatrics
The family lockdown guide: how to emotionally prepare for coronavirus quarantine
What can parents and children do to survive self-isolation, and each other?
The ultimate kids' guide to the new coronavirus
"Will school be closed?" and "Should I be worried about getting sick?"
Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope With the Coronavirus Disease 2019

Provides information for parents and caregivers about infectious disease outbreaks in your community. Knowing important information about the outbreak and learning how to be prepared can reduce stress and help calm likely anxieties.
Looking for information to give to Parents?
Healthy at Home: A Toolkit for Supporting Families Impacted by COVID-19
With the growing impact of the COVID-19 virus, ReadyRosie is developing this free toolkit as a resource to support families with information and resources for supporting the children in their care.

a.title: Open Document, NASEM Forum for Children's Well-Being - COVID-19 Resources
